member.name: DirectX.CreateDXGIFactory2

summary.para: Creates a DXGI 1.3 factory that you can use to generate other DXGI objects.

In Windows 8, any DXGI factory created while DXGIDebug.dll was present on the system would load and use it. Starting in Windows 8.1, apps explicitly request that DXGIDebug.dll be loaded instead. Use CreateDXGIFactory2 and specify the DXGI_CREATE_FACTORY_DEBUG flag to request DXGIDebug.dll; the DLL will be loaded if it is present on the system.

param.name: Flags
param.para: Valid values include the DXGI_CREATE_FACTORY_DEBUG (0x01) flag, and zero.
param.div:
Note This flag will be set by the D3D runtime if:
The system creates an implicit factory during device creation.
The D3D11_CREATE_DEVICE_DEBUG flag is specified during device creation, for example using (or the swapchain method, or the Direct3D 10 equivalents).

member.param: The globally unique identifier (GUID) of the object referenced by the ppFactory parameter.
Address of a pointer to an object.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.
